name: RSM Game Jam 2014
body:
# Welcome to this year's RSM game jam!
Let's make retro games!

## General Information
Specific themes will be revealed during Friday, but in general games should have a "retro feel".
We will get access to Eriksbergshallen, where we have an area to jam in, at 7:00 tomorrow. Remember to bring the badge you as a jammer will receive during Friday!
Voting will be happening during the whole RSM event. The key to winning is to put out prototypes early and often to the demo computers on the green tables! The prize ceremony starts at 17 

## Contact Details
* Erik Einebrant 0738351442 erik@einebrant.se
* Edvard Rutstr√∂m 0737104922 liquidcrate@gmail.com
* Jacob Michelsen 0733706458 chromegadget@gmail.com

## Tools
Since we have very little time, we recommend sticking to a simple but fun idea and using tools you are already familiar with. Here are some useful links to give you a head start in making games.

### Unity
* [2D platformer game example project (includes git repo)](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3877194/RSM-Jam/UnityExamples/2DPlatformerUnityExample.zip)
* [2D space shooter game example project (includes git repo)](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3877194/RSM-Jam/UnityExamples/2DSpaceShooterUnityExample.zip)
* [A .gitignore for Unity](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3877194/RSM-Jam/UnityExamples/gitignore)

### Java
* [Slick2D Library](http://slick.ninjacave.com)

### Flash
* [Flashdevelop open source IDE for Actionscript 3](http://www.flashdevelop.org)
* [Flashpunk library](http://useflashpunk.net)
* [Flixel library](http://flixel.org)

### Python
* [PyGame](http://pygame.org/)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
